name: redict
tagline: A Redis compatible datastore implemented in Rust
description: Redict is a Redis-compatible data store implemented in Rust. It offers memory efficiency, performance, and persistence while maintaining Redis protocol compatibility.

features.title: Redis Compatibility
features.description: Drop-in replacement for Redis with support for existing commands and protocols

features.title: Memory Efficiency
features.description: Optimized data structures reduce memory usage compared to traditional Redis

features.title: Persistence Options
features.description: Choose between RDB snapshots and AOF logs for data durability

features.title: Replication Support
features.description: Set up primary-replica configurations for high availability and read scaling

features.title: Pub/sub Messaging
features.description: Implement real-time messaging patterns with channel subscriptions

features.title: Data Structures
features.description: Work with strings, lists, sets, sorted sets, and hashes using familiar Redis commands

features.title: Transactions
features.description: Execute multiple commands atomically using MULTI/EXEC blocks

features.title: Lua Scripting
features.description: Run server-side scripts for complex operations and atomic workflows
